newsitem.title: INDIA: India's SIDBI 2.0 bln rupee bonds oversubscribed.
newsitem.headline: India's SIDBI 2.0 bln rupee bonds oversubscribed.

text.p: The Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) said on Monday its issue of unsecured bonds totalling 2.0 billion rupees was oversubscribed.
The bonds, with a face value of 100,000 rupees each, carry a coupon rate of 15.5 percent per annum.
"The issue, which opened for subscription today received an overwhelming response and was oversubscribed more than four times within an hour of opening," a SIDBI statement said.
SIDBI said it was exercising an option to retain oversubscription up to 1.0 billion rupees.

The private placement of bonds was arranged by SBI Capital Markets, RR Financial Consultants, IDBI Capital Market Services, jointly with Darashaw & Company, Kotak Mahindra Capital and Peregrine Capital India, it said.
